alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 4:08PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Marion and Fayette Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 408 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hamilton to near Bluff to near Millport. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Fayette, Guin, Hackleburg, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Belk, Gu- Win, Bankston, Bluff, Brinn, Lake Buttahatchee, Bear Creek, Twin, Tucker, Stone Wall, Wayside, Richard Arthur Field, Fayette County Public Lake and Upper Bear Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Alabama.
